description: The route_id field contains an ID that uniquely identifies a route. The route_id is dataset unique. Note that because this layer is a combination of two agency datasets, route_id may not be unique unless combined with the agency_id field

The short name of a route. This will often be a short, abstract identifier like "32", "100X", or "Green" that riders use to identify a route, but which doesn't give any indication of what places the route serves.
The full name of a route. This name is generally more descriptive than the short name and will often include the route's destination or stop.
The type of transportation used on a route
possible_values: 0 - Tram, Streetcar, Light rail. Any light rail or street level system within a metropolitan area (includes Trolley); 1 - Subway, Metro. Any underground rail system within a metropolitan area; 2 - Rail. Used for intercity or long-distance travel; 3 - Bus. Used for short- and long-distance bus routes; 4 - Ferry. Used for short- and long-distance boat service; 5 - Cable car. Used for street-level cable cars where the cable runs beneath the car; 6 - Gondola, Suspended cable car. Typically used for aerial cable cars where the car is suspended from the cable; 7 - Funicular. Any rail system designed for steep inclines.

description: The URL of a web page about that particular route
